fullText: The show works best when it leans into its fairy-tale romance rather than getting bogged down in historical drama, with McNeal's radiant performance at its center.
dtliExcerpt: The show works best when it leans into its fairy-tale romance rather than getting bogged down in historical drama, with McNeal's radiant performance at its center.
bwwExcerpt: The key selling point of this pretty but anodyne musical, which ends up being more satisfying than the sum of its parts. It's a fairy-tale whose princess chooses her own kind of prince, a destiny foretold in the stirring shared childhood recollection of Dmitry and Anya, 'In a Crowd of Thousands.' It's kitschy, old-fashioned entertainment given a relatively sophisticated presentation, and you have to acknowledge its success when you hear the target demographic swoon on cue.
